channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The path is slippy and dirty due to tree leaves. Now the trees have fallen can they be removed in time for summer please, 16th January
item.description:
The path that runs along the river. Halt from old bath road to keynsham road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Baths Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Oblong deep pothole caused by water scour, 16th January
item.description:
At the junction of Ashleigh Lane and Cleeve Hill an oblong deep pothole running paralell to Cleeve Hill and across Ashleigh Lane. Depth about 100mm as can be seen from the visibilty of the sides of the cobble blocks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashleigh Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox and two deer, 16th January
item.description:
They been on central carriageway for weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Contractor has broken a finger post, 16th January
item.description:
A contractor working in Church Road has broken a finger post at the junction of Church Road and Quat Goose Lane. Can it be fixed (and at the expense of the contractor not local council tax payers)?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Church Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign structurally damaged/leaning more than 20 degrees/loose in ground (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 16th January
item.description:
28day with road closure plus 2m barriers needed prior to works starting please cut back overgrown hedge brambles and vegetation back to boundary 25000x3000mm 25m/3m (Overgrown Hedge)

item.title: TMC - Defects - Footways Slabs problem, 16th January
item.description:

item.title: Unsightly fly tipping, 16th January
